content: all in one mini easter chick - amigurumi pattern by criss wall i have a huge collection of scrap balls of yarn i really wanted to use them instead of throwing them out so i started crocheting small toys to leave around for people to find they turned out to be so popular i just can t stop making them i know that there are a few lovely chick patterns out there already but some of them are large and take quite a while to finish i wanted to create a small series of patterns that take less than 30 mins to complete i make a lot of my chicks with the cool little sunglasses adornments you can buy from aliexpress and amazon but as you can see they look great with normal safety eyes too this small chick takes about 15 mins from start to finish i do have a larger chick pattern available as well but i wanted a mini one that is also an all-in-one us terms stitches  chain chain  slip_stitch slip_stitch  single_crochet single_crochet  increase increase single_crochet  decrease decrease single_crochet  flo work in the front loop of the stitch only  blo work in the back loop of the stitch only notes and materials  you can use any yarn and hook of your choice based on yarn thickness as a guide i usually use 3 5mm for dk/8ply and 4mm for aran/10ply  you will need two different colours i use yellow for the chick body and a little orange for the beak/feet  i use about 8 metres 8 ¾ yards of 8ply yarn for each  using 8ply and a 3 5mm hook the finished size is 5cm x 4cm  either 1 pair of safety eyes either 6mm or 8mm or 1 pair of small glue on sunglasses 2cm the larger coloured sunglasses i use for my owl are too big for this chick  it takes me approx 15 minutes to complete one chick criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-mini-easter-chick all in one easter chick instructions you will need to keep track of the beginning of each row as the tail and wings need to be placed in certain stitches use a stitch marker or thread a piece of yarn through the work row 1 using the body colour single_crochet 6 into a magic_ring 6 stitches row 2 *increase in next single_crochet single_crochet 1* repeat around 9 stitches row 3 *increase in next single_crochet single_crochet 2* repeat around 12 stitches row 4 single_crochet 12 12 stitches row 5 *increase in next single_crochet single_crochet 2* repeat around 16 stitches row 6 we complete the wings in this row single_crochet 7 the green stitches are all in the front loop of one stitch slip_stitch into the front loop of the next stitch
